intro: Barneoudia cyanoleuca, commonly known as the blue-green spurge, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 20 centimeters. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that are often blue-green in color, which help it conserve water in dry environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually green or yellow and appear in clusters. Barneoudia cyanoleuca is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
